detail.content: Queer Performance: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Queer Performance  PERF-UT 202.  4 Credits Instructor(s): Check Albert This course is an introduction to queer critique through a decidedly   performance studies lens. We will spend our semester examining   performances (including political demonstrations, nightlife cultures,   photography, experimental film and video, visual and conceptual art)   that offer / queer alternatives / to “gay and lesbian politics.” We will   also take a specifically performance studies approach to the notion of   “theory,” by looking at anti-normative performances as examples of queer   theory in motion. Special attention will be paid to queer politics and   performance in contemporary New York City, with its rich abundance of   dissident sexual subcultures (including punk and house-ball cultures;   queer anti-marriage collectives, and AIDS activist video collectives).   These more “organic” sites of queer theory we will be placed in   conversation with essays and manuscripts by Samuel R. Delany, Judith   Halberstam, Jose Esteban Munoz, Lisa Duggan, Fiona Buckland, Lee   Edelman, and David Roman, among many others.   Check Albert for course description.  Electives (12 Points)           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Admin & Faculty: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Performance Studies About the Program Admissions BA Program MA Program PhD Program Course Offerings Admin & Faculty Students Alumni PS Spotlights  News & Events Projects & Publications Blog Facebook  home > Performance Studies > Admin & Faculty          Performance Studies as a field of study began at NYU. The areas of research Faculty within the Department of Performance Studies undertake are as varied as the field of Performance Studies. All members of the faculty are widely recognized as leading authorities in their respective areas of research.    The varied interest areas and diverse backgrounds of our faculty provide an exciting and dynamic learning environment. Faculty areas of interest range from dance to aesthetics of everyday life; from theories directing to queer and feminist theory; from performance and politics to performance and healing.    Performance Studies Faculty integrate theory and practice and utilize various methods of research and analysis including fieldwork, archival research, interviews, and movement analysis. Barbara Browning Associate Professor, Performance Studies More Deborah A Kapchan Associate Professor, Performance Studies Affiliated Associate Professor, Anthropology, Middle East Studies, Music More André Lepecki Associate Professor, Performance Studies More Tavia Nyong'o Associate Professor, Performance Studies More Ann Pellegrini Professor, Performance Studies and Social and Cultural Analysis More Richard Schechner University Professor; Professor, Performance Studies More Karen Shimakawa Chair, Associate Professor, Performance Studies More Anna Deavere Smith University Professor; Professor, Performance Studies and Art and Public Policy Affiliate, NYU School of Law More Diana Taylor University Professor, Performance Studies and Spanish More Allen S Weiss Associate Teacher, Performance Studies and Cinema Studies More   Open Faculty Positions Affiliated Faculty Performance Studies Administration & Staff  Department of Performance Studies 721 Broadway, 6th Floor New York, NY 10003               Phone:       212 998 1620               Fax:       212 995 4571 performance.studies@nyu.edu           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
